nyx.utils.file_fn.write_json(path: Path | str, data: dict, as_string=False, sort_keys=True, indent=4)[source]¶

Write json file.

Parameters:

  • path (pathlib.Path | str) – path to json file.

  • data (dict) – data to write.

  • as_string (bool, optional) – write data as json string. Defaults to False.

  • sort_keys (bool, optional) – sort data keys. Defaults to True.

  • indent (int, optional) – indentation inside written file. Defaults to 4.

Returns:

path to written file.

Return type:

pathlib.Path

Bases: Enum

Enum of log format strings.

class nyx.utils.logging_fn.QSignalHandler(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Handler

emit(record: LogRecord)[source]¶

Do whatever it takes to actually log the specified logging record.

This version is intended to be implemented by subclasses and so raises a NotImplementedError.

nyx.utils.logging_fn.get_logger(name: str, level: int = 10, file_level: int = 40, file_name: str = 'nyx.log', std_format: str = '[%(levelname)s][%(name)s] %(message)s', file_format: str = '%(asctime)s | %(levelname)s | %(name)s | %(message)s')[source]¶

Get logger object.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – logger name.

  • level (int, optional) – logging level. Defaults to logging.DEBUG.

  • file_level (int, optional) – logging level for file handler. Defaults to logging.ERROR.

  • file_name (str, optional) – base logging file name. Defaults to const.MAIN_LOGGER_NAME.

  • std_format (str, optional) – logging format string for stream handler. Defaults to LogFormat.basic.value.

  • file_format (str, optional) – logging format string for file handler. Defaults to LogFormat.verbose.value.

Returns:

logger object with given name.

Return type:

logging.Logger
